events.title: Maryland Ratifies the United States Constitution
events.description: Maryland becomes the seventh state to ratify the U.S. Constitution, helping to pave the way for the creation of the United States government under this new national framework.
events.significance: This ratification was crucial in the formation of the United States federal government and the successful adoption of the U.S. Constitution.

events.title: Spanish Civil War Ends with Madrid's Fall
events.description: The city of Madrid falls to Francisco Franco's Nationalist forces, effectively ending the Spanish Civil War after nearly three years of conflict.
events.significance: The conclusion of the Spanish Civil War established Franco's dictatorship, which lasted until his death in 1975, shaping Spain's political landscape for decades.

events.title: The Intel Pentium Microprocessor Debuts
events.description: Intel announces the first Pentium microprocessor, marking a significant improvement in computer processing power and performance for personal computers.
events.significance: The Pentium processor was instrumental in advancing computer technology, influencing the development of PC hardware and software industries.

events.title: Saint Petersburg Subway Bombing
events.description: A terrorist bombing targets the Saint Petersburg metro system in Russia, resulting in multiple casualties and injuries.
events.significance: This event highlighted ongoing security challenges related to terrorism in Russia and prompted increased measures in public safety and counterterrorism.

events.title: New Horizons Spacecraft's Close Approach to Pluto
events.description: NASA's New Horizons spacecraft performs its closest flyby of Pluto, gathering unprecedented data and images of the dwarf planet.
events.significance: This milestone expanded human knowledge of the outer solar system and Pluto, providing insights into planetary science and the nature of distant celestial bodies.
